title: Thin film - 900 nm wave and glass-coating-air

content.question: Infrared waves of wavelength <math alttext="900 nanometers" overflow="scroll"><mn>900</mn><mspace width="0.2em"></mspace><mi>nm</mi></math> in air are incident normally on a thin layer of material that coats a glass object, as shown in the figure. The thickness of the coating is <math alttext="150 nanometers" overflow="scroll"><mn>150</mn><mspace width="0.2em"></mspace><mi>nm</mi></math>. The refractive index of the glass is <math alttext="1.45" overflow="scroll"><mn>1.45</mn></math>, and the refractive index of the coating is greater than the refractive index of the glass. If the light reflecting off the air-coating and coating-glass interfaces completely interferes destructively in the air, which of the following could be the refractive index of the coating?

skill.text: 2.B: Calculate or estimate an unknown quantity with units from known quantities, by selecting and following a logical computational pathway.
